text: One of the first games I played with family that lived far away. We had some great adventures.
author: Gr8saiyaman88

text: Has anyone played this game recently? If you make a "burning character" (one per server per account) you level up 3 times each time you gain a level (from levels 8/10~ to level 149). This solves the boring leveling at levels 35~+ but destroys the slow and steady pacing the intro (the first 25 levels) of the game has. They changed too much around the early parts of the game now too, in addition. Some of the NPCs can't be spoken to anymore and you can just instantly start at level 8/10 already placed at the job trainer you want. It kinda destroys the adventure, but it does reflect the rest of the game. Just grindy and lack of adventure after you get a few dozens levels into the game, as the original devs are long gone and only riding on monetary goals.
author: dddmemaybe

text: Hearing this the moment you get off the boat is so humbling and exciting. The start of an adventure. You might have spent 6 months getting the 3rd job but it was all worth it. You mightve gone back to Lith Harbor maybe 3 or 4 times but this song will remain with you because its the start, its how it all began. Your journey, your grind, your Maple life. This song brings back so many fond memories.

text: Seriously stunning :s
author: greenyxi

text: Man, I used to tell my friends that the slimes outside Lith gave more experience than in other places just so I could have an excuse to listen to this song back when I was in middle school.  Sitting here now and listening to it while writing the final essay of my college career, it really helps put things into perspective.  Thanks for the good times, Maplestory.
author: Sam Smith

text: The moment I started playing this game I took the black cab and ended up in the final dungeon. I was level 1, a friend of mine had to escort me back to the closest safe area. Good times back when I sucked at PC games :D

text: I think I teared up a little bit hearing this. Reminds me of my high school days back around 2007-2008. Where you would spend weeks trying to get to 70. Not a day. What happened to such a glorious game....? Right in the nostalgia, though. Loved this game way back when.

This hella takes me back though.

text: I used to play Maplestory, until the day my connection to the server wasn't working anymore. I never knew why.  I was considering to play it again, but I was told it's for little kids. Seriously? The website says it's aimed at people 13 and over! If people researched more, I believe, then we wouldn't have this problem.

text: Having recently given maplestory another go after many years since i played it only until about level 30, the music actually took me by surprise and i enjoyed just about every track that played entering map after map. It reminds me of old jrpgs like chrono cross that brings it above every other mundane ost found in the majority of mmorpgs.

text: I've played MapleStory since 2007, although this is a great track there are many more.  Most of my favorite tracks and nostalgia has to be in Ludibrium.  Viking parties, and Grim parties with a DK (I was a Priest) were some of the best gaming moments of my life.  There is a track in Temple of Time called Time Gate which isn't the theme of any hunting ground but a transport map and is one of my favorites.  Keep up the good work SupraDarky!

text: Maple Story's music always brings back some of the most colorful and social gaming memories of my life. Good stuff, man. Good stuff.

author: Sephiko

text:
This actually makes me tear up..
I met my girlfriend on Maplestory. And what turned into a game relationship, transformed into a real one. I even managed to meet her in person. Long distance hurts, but it's so worth feeling emotions like this.
author: knightpal

text: Man, Maplestory.. one of my first MMOs, I think after Ragnarok Online. I knew from the start that it was silly and childish and the community is filled with 12-year old boys (which I pretty much was at the time), but it's still a great game. The areas are absolutely beautiful and the music is fantastic. You should check out the song called "Tree Dungeon" and "Sleepywood". They're both very similar, but my favorite tracks from the game. So many memories!

text:
I'm not sure how long it's been since you played it, but the past year or so they seem to have been improving the gameplay, mostly by lowering the grinding needed to level up. The last time I played it, I barely needed to grind at all. They've been adding more of a story too.

But yeah, they do always have nice soundtracks. Ragnorak had a really good one too.

The break at 2:58 is nice and relaxing.
